metadata.title: CVE-2024-26590 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: erofs:fix inconsistent per-file compression format EROFS can select compressionalgorithms on a per-file basis, and each per-file compression algorithmneeds to be marked in the on-disk superblock for initialization. However,syzkaller can generate inconsistent crafted images that use an unsupportedalgorithmtype for specific inodes, e.g. use MicroLZMA algorithmtype evenit's not set in `sbi->available_compr_algs`. This can lead to an unexpected"BUG: kernel NULL pointer dereference" if the corresponding decompressorisn't built-in. Fix this by checking against `sbi->available_compr_algs`for each m_algorithmformat request. Incorrect !erofs_sb_has_compr_cfgspreset bitmap is now fixed together since it was harmless previously.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26590` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required
